channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: It’s not the Fed’s job to make the stock market ‘comfortable’ says Fed president
item.description: Analysts holding out for the Fed to rescue the stock market might be waiting in vain

item.title: As riots and disorder spread, some countries warn their citizens not to travel to the UK
item.description: Five countries have issued travel and safety warnings to their citizens living or visiting the U.K. as riots and street disorder continue to plague the country.

item.title: Treasury yields rise off of 12-month lows
4 die and over 1,600 flights cancelled after Tropical Storm Debby slams Florida
item.description: Debby made landfall along the Gulf Coast of Florida early Monday as a Category 1 hurricane. It since has weakened to a tropical storm and is moving slowly.

item.title: Tuesday's analyst calls: Taiwan Semiconductor a buying opportunity, CrowdStrike upgraded
item.description: A chipmaker and a beleaguered cybersecurity stock were among the stocks being talked about by analysts on Tuesday.

item.title: The unwinding of the carry trade may have run its course
Pope Francis reveals his summer reading list and love for tragedies as he encourages young priests to read a ‘good’ book
item.description: In his letter the Pope made references to literary greats like C.S. Lewis, Marcel Proust, T. S. Eliot and fellow Argentinian Jorge Luis Borges.

item.title: 10-year Treasury yield rebounds after hitting its lowest level in more than a year
item.description: Treasury yields bounced back on Tuesday as investors closely monitored a reversal of the previous day's global market sell-off.

item.title: Japan’s Nikkei rallies 11% a day after its plunge triggered global selloff
Olympic boxer Imane Khelif hailed a ‘heroine’ by her home village despite gender row
item.description: Imane has found herself in the middle of a heated global row after it emerged that she had previously failed unspecified gender eligibility tests.

item.title: Biggest concern is the market sell-off becoming a 'self-fulfilling prophecy,' research firm warns
item.description: The global stock market sell-off of recent days could be a "self-fulfilling prophecy" and eventually lead to a recession, Morningstar DBRS analysts warned.

item.title: Stock market’s losses are unlikely to last, as AI trade comes roaring back
IBM’s former head of AI says Big Tech needs to end arms race in LLMs to ditch its carbon backpack
item.description: Seth Dobrin favors energy-efficient small language models and calls for a new ‘paradigm of cooling’ to solve AI's growing sustainability dilemma.

item.title: Oil giant Saudi Aramco's second-quarter profit dips 3% on lower crude production volumes
item.description: Saudi Aramco reported $29.1 billion in net profit for the second quarter, a dip of 3% from the same period last year as production volumes remained low.

item.title: Poletti: Google’s loss in antitrust case will have industry-wide ramifications
